answers.text:
Jon – I think one of the better IT Governance Policies I’ve seen is the City of Las Vegas, NV.  I’ve attached a copy for your review.  
As well, below are links to a couple others that I hope you find useful:  
Portland, OR - BEST PRACTICES FOR INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY GOVERNANCE  
http://www.portlandonline.com/shared/cfm/image.cfm?id=91780 
Atlanta, GA – IT Governance  
http://www.atlantaga.gov/government/it/itgovernance.aspx 
Bainbridge Island, WA - Manual of City Governance Policies, Procedures and Guidelines Resolution   Adopted March 10, 2010 - http://www.mrsc.org/PolicyProcedures/B29GovMan.pdf 
Pamela Muse  
Western Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation  
888-468-6450  
pmuse@transformgov.org

Dave

author: Jon Amundson
text: We are in the process of establishing an IT Governance Committee for the City. As part of that process we are trying determine the "point of entry" process that trigger what projects go before a governance committee and what can be determined at the technical and/or departmental level. What do you do? What type of business case documentation do you have? Anything you might might have would be very appreciated.
title: Business Case Criteria/Models for IT Projects
